AWESOME!!! Hubby ordered full strip spare ribs, with a bowl of chili and mashed potatoes. I had the mahi-mahi, fish tacos. Very good!!! All in all, very satisfied and happy

name: Jim Habeck
text: Food not cooked to request.  Manager failed to maintain social distancing.

name: David Lee
text: The bbq brisket burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had. But the sweet tea didn't have enough sugar in it. Nothing ruins a meal for me more than sugarless "sweet tea". It's like drinking brown water, and paying three bucks for it. It's down right insulting! This is the south, put more sugar in that tea!!

name: Brian McDonald
text: Had the Dark Side Flight beer assortment... Red & Brunette is always my favorite!! Lemon Tyme Chicken was phenomenal!!! Chicken was so tender it is as if it were rotisserie!! Also took the Monkey Bread Poozokie to-go... Had it in the past and was REALLY good!!

name: Summer King
text: Seriously delicious fries! Great burgers. Tasty apps, with a wide variety beyond the usual. Really really good! We'll be back Monday night for their pizza Special!

name: Josephine Maddox
text: Every thing was unacceptable my family an I will not return ever

name: Lesley Gunn
text: Waitress wasn't on her job too slow and food was nasty...

name: David Lee
text: The bbq brisket burger was one of the best burgers I've ever had. But the sweet tea didn't have enough sugar in it. Nothing ruins a meal for me more than sugarless "sweet tea". It's like drinking brown water, and paying three bucks for it. It's down right insulting! This is the south, put more sugar in that tea!!

name: Jim Habeck
text: Food not cooked to request.  Manager failed to maintain social distancing.

name: William Tackett
text: Mediocre food, burgers not hot. Asparagus tough, undercooked. Prices way too high! Will not go back.

name: Billy Shook
text: The food was sub par and overpriced. Wouldn't go back or recommend.

name: Crystal Reynolds
text: Even after a month I'm still thinking about how good the chicken and brussel sprouts was even at 12 at night it was awesome this was during Mardi Gras and there was literally nothing else good open and I happened upon this place I've never heard of amazing and everyone was super nice even though it was really and they were about to close within the hour.

name: Jamal Jamal
text: This is not a deep dish pizza. I love Chicago style pizzas and this was more Pizza Hut. They charge $ 30 for this pizza which is the going rate for a Chicago style pizza but this wasn't it. Pizza was good but not what I expected and definitely over priced. The picture on their menu with the pizza in the deep dish pan is very misleading.

name: Mike Cooney
text: It's funny how they make you wear mask to walk in but employees can't even wear them correctly or at all so what is the point

name: LaKesha Fagan
text: Tchlinda was a great and informative server. Loved her suggestions and my pizookie!

name: Courtney
text: At first glance it looks like the regular old BJ's restaurant and brewery that you would typically go to except for there are some changes due to Covid 19 which is understandable. I looked up and I saw a sign that said to go orders, I said hey I'll try that for my lunch tomorrow. So I ordered this to go pasta and when I raised the lid it smelled like putrid rotten vegetables thrown into a plastic box to the extent that it made me want to vomit immediately. I hope no one ever has this terrible experience I had and maybe they need to check the to-go boxes before handing them out to people, I was highly disappointed and I will not be getting anything from there again.

name: Nathan Jones
text: The Jambalaya made me sick, some of the contents was not fresh. I went there on 9/9 for dinner, now I have to eat soft foods until my stomach recovers.

name: Millie Hartzog
text:
First this is the first time I have ever written a review but felt it necessary.
The restaurant had an association meeting with a large group of people and instead of being prepared with enough staff to cover the large group....it was not.  First problem-we were trying to get a table to seat 8 people for a birthday celebration.  Manager at one point told me to "go figure out what you want and let me know"... After figuring out a place to sit we then have to deal with a bad first waiter.  Our "1st" waiter left our table without saying a word to us 3 times to answer questions such as (1) can happy hour prices be given to us since we did not sit in the bar area; (2) if the restaurant carried Flat Tire beer; (Excuse me but isn't this restaurant a brewhouse?); and (3)  does the restaurant have diet tonic, diet sprite or any diet drinks.  At one point the waiter told our table that he had just had a long day and was tired.  So, he complained to the manager about us and we were given another waitress.  She (Kayla B.) was great.  At one point since there was only 1 bartender on duty (really when you know you have a group of 50 to 75 women maybe more bartenders would be a good idea!) she ended up preparing our cocktails.  One person in our group ordered double meat pizzas to take home to her family.  She had to send the pizzas back because there was no meat on them!!  We arrived at 5:30 p.m. and did not receive our water and/or drinks until 6:15!

name: Elisjsha Sexton
text: I didnt even get seated, I was told 20min wait, and then another 30min, and then another 20min. I was looking forward to trying it for the first time but after seeing 3 couples leave that arrived after me, im not going back

name: Vera Ringold
text: The food was delicious and the service was great. Considering the social distancing everything was perfect. We will definitely be back.

name: Emily S
text: Love this place! Visited multiple times with the same, great service every time. Food is great! Portions are big, so expect to take some home. They offer free dessert if you download their app!

name: Michael Ellis
text: Awesome as always would give 10 stars if I could.

name: pinkesh mistry
text:
Server (Ashley) was friendly, helped me put my custom pita taco order together.
Liked the food and place.

name: Megan Bolton
text: I love the food. The whole family enjoyed it. Cant wait to try their brews.

name: Kim Kraner
text: DINING ROOM NOW OPEN in big bold letters on the sign draping the door...4:20 pm on a Tue afternoon...5 cars in the lot and approximately 10-15 total guests...walked in only to be told it would be a 20 min WAIT?!  More staff needed for SURE! :(

name: Donna Marie
text: The food is okay. The price's where a little high for what you get. The staff seemed like they had no energy at all. The place is very clean and nice looking though. I just won't be back, I've had much better food at much more affordable prices.

name: Kimberly Lombardi
text: Great menu. Good food awesome Service.

name: Markell Johnson
text: Very disappointed. The food has been very bland lately and every time I order a pizookie with CHOCOLATE ice cream I receive vanilla ice cream. It doesn’t matter which app I order it in. You guys have lost a customer and it’s a shame because the pizookies are good but you can’t even include the correct ice cream flavor.

name: Laverne Robinson
text: I had a good time I will be back

name: Neda Brewton
text: First time we've been here and we loved it. Missy was our waitress and was great. The food was really good. Restaurant was clean but needed to be dusted around the booths. A little dust will not keep us from coming back.

name: Eric Green
text: So many choices so little time. I just loved their lemon thyme chicken

name: Cynthia Young
text: The food was delicious, the restaurant could have been cleaner, dusty, finger prints on the windows, table sticky.

name: Bea Bowers
text: Ribeye was delicious, service was poor. Person seating us was unprepared and separated 2 tables for us to sit. We weren't asked table or booth. We waited a long time for water and soda.  I had to get up to ask for napkins. Salads came out and we had to wait for silverware. There was no salt or pepper on table.  My husband's dirty (salad) dish remained on table throughout meal. Garlic butter was not fully melted. Beer was cool, not cold. We were very disappointed.

name: Jessica Stuck
text: If I could leave no stars I would for the horrible service from the hostess and staff! They only had 5 tables with people in the whole empty restaurant but when they sat us and we clearly had 5 people they tried to put us at a 4 person table and when I told them we had 5 they said that we'd have to wait longer. There were several booths and tables that were far away from the other diners more than 6ft away but they said those were closed. They even tried to tell us to stand outside even though my parents could not stand outside in the heat to wait for another table! They were very rude about it as well even though we were more than 6ft from the hostess. We just left after that and will not be back.

name: Darlene Daffin
text: Had dinner there last evening...good food, great service.  Went back this afternoon for drinks; sat in booth in bar area for over 10 min. and NO ONE came for our order.  Heard discussion among servers that we were there for drinks only!  NOT family friendly as advertised!!!

name: Tonnetta Esprit
text: Omg, James the waiter was sooooo amazing and professional. Food and drinks was good too.

name: bordurlin
text: This restaurant has one of the most diverse menus I've ever seen in a restaurant.  Also, it has a very LARGE selection of dishes.  Everything I've ever eaten here was very good.  I think the prices are a little high, but the service has always been very good, and the food is, too.  So, I'll keep going back.  I still can't believe how good the menu is...

name: Crystal Reynolds
text: Even after a month I'm still thinking about how good the chicken and brussel sprouts was even at 12 at night it was awesome this was during Mardi Gras and there was literally nothing else good open and I happened upon this place I've never heard of amazing and everyone was super nice even though it was really and they were about to close within the hour.

name: Alexia Whalen
text: STOP PUTTING BROCOLLI ON THE FETTECINI. Everyone takes it off anyways, no one thinks that’s good. Thank you!

name: Anthony Welborn
text: The food was very good but the wait for a table was annoying with so many empty tables everywhere.

name: Dee Burdette
text: Fish and chips were very good. Alexis was excellent

name: Ralph Lindsey
text: Excellent, BJs favorite pizza was to for.....and Mandy was our server👍 who has a great personality and very accommodating.

name: Brittany Ulmer
text: I read about this place online. The reviews I saw were raving and everyone seemed to be excited. For every bad review/ opinion I saw there were 15 great ones. I was in the area of the restaurant  and finally decided to come and try it out. I came in the middle of a lunch rush purposely on a Friday to see how my experience would be. I was not disappointed!! The door was great and the service was even better. The menu is diverse and there is literally something for everyone. I have been back on multiple occasions and I have not been let down. I use the app for take out and I have yet to be left unsatisfied. BJ's is a family friendly environment and I highly recommend it!

name: Scott Gordy
text: Very good variety. Nice, cozy atmosphere with a sports backdrop. The in-house beers are very good, but the Porter is among the best I have had.

name: Erik Johansen
text: Bunless burgers should be served on a plate, not on paper.

name: Vicki Radavich
text: Waitstaff knows their brews!

name: tony guin
text: The food was good and the service but they entire menu is unmistakably way over priced.   I ordered the classic prime rib dip sandwich. The photo shows this very nice sandwich on a medium size French  Bread,  a nice pile of  beautiful med cooked shaved prime rib,  which is the true way of doing prime rib.  All for the price of $15.50. Almost the price of a prime rib steak. When the sandwiches showed up I was very disappointed for that price. The bun  was small and narrow what you would like a  jumbo hot dog for.  Maybe a half pound I guess it was prime rib could just be roast beef but fully cooked. nowhere near worth that price.  It was like I went to buy a Cadillac and got a Pinto at a Cadillac price. And even if the food is good I won't go back for over price food.

name: Dorris Thomas
text: Food and service were excellent

name: Rashida
text: I recently visited with a coworker, but today I brought my family for their first visit. From the first greeting, everything was incredible!! All of the staff worked as a team & seemed happy to be there. You can tell they take pride in cleanliness, too! Very nicely decorated, food was impeccable, and lastly (but definitely not least), my waitress (Darnisha) was AMAZING!! She was very knowledgeable of the menu items, friendly, precise...I can go on & on. The only complaint is BJ's didn't come to Mobile sooner than they did. Thank you all so much!!!

name: Zack Davis
text: This is a pretty good lunch spot. The piadinis are really tasty and the fries are great. The beer selection is also really good even if the Bj's brand brews are mediocre at best. The only two criticisms I have are that 1. This place is mad corporate. There's none of that culture that you feel in the local places that these restaurants are trying to emulate. And 2. Food is a little over priced. You can get it cheaper and better at the local restaurants this place so desperately wants to feel like.

name: Curt Crider
text: BJ's has a nice bar atmosphere, even in the dining area. High ceilings, overstuffed booths,  nice woody interior. The menu is wide and varied. If you can't find something to eat then you are not hungry. The bar menu with all of its beers and wines and cocktails is likely to have your favorite as well as having something you should try. Catch the Happy Hour menu to make a really affordable evening. I had the veggie burger which I think was a garden burger patty. Very good with the Chipotle mayo and fried jalapenos. I also had the craft root beer and it was very good.

name: Gina Crenshaw
text: Been here twice, service was decent, but the food isn't great, my first visit I had the prime rib sandwich and when it arrived it wasn't very hot and for the price you pay $15, they didn't give you much meat on that very slender hoagie bun, plus it was bland... Even though on my first visit the food wasn't good, I did give them a second try on another visit, I didn't want to completely write them off so quickly since they did have lots of other items to try on their menu, so the second time I ordered the steak (medium well) with a loaded baked potato and broccoli for sides...When it arrived, I immediately felt like for the price you pay $18, the steak could have been a bit bigger, but the kicker was when I cut into it, it was not cooked medium well like I asked, it was well done and very dry and on top of that, the broccoli taste like it had been microwaved and was not seasoned at all or hot, the only thing that was edible was my loaded baked potato...I have to say I probably won't be back again, the service was fine, but the food honestly is not great and overpriced....I tried. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

name: Peggy H
text: Great food and our waitress Sabrina was excellent!! We will definitely be eating here a lot in the future because there are so many things we want to try!!

name: Tyler Boney
text: BJ's is a great place to grab a bite to eat! The pizza and salmon is good! And the pizookies are AMAZING! good service too!

name: Mika Holt
text: Loved it, good variety of food for everyone, friendly staff and decent prices

name: Darlennia Payton
text: The food was good. Friendly server.  The restrooms were very clean.

name: Menchu King
text: Good food.

name: Ethan F.
text: The food isn't fantastic for the price, except for the happy hour, the drinks ain't cheap either. Seating area is reasonably comfortable and cozy.

name: Kris Waters
text: Absolutely loved it

name: Kyra Reid
text: Went on the half off pizza special day, and that pizza was huge! Deep dish, so many toppings, dripping with cheese, the whole deal! (Also, the house made root beer is amazing! Definitely a new favorite!) We'll certainly be back to try out some more menu options!

name: Danny Wolfe
text: Not. Wearing. A. Mask. For. 10. Feet.

name: Morgan Tyrone
text: Good food terrible waitor

name: Erin Kauffman
text: Excellent pizza at a great price! Monday is half off pizza. We had the tomato and basil pizza and added sausage to it. With the chips and fire roasted tomato salsa as a starter. For two, our total was $18! Can't beat that!

name: Ashley Seale
text: So much to choose from! Service can be casually slower but well worth it. Lots of chooses for kids and they bring out a super cute kid appetizer to keep the little ones occupied while waiting for the food to come :)

name: Cary Reams
text: It is EXTREMELY Rare that I write a Negative Review - EXTREMELY, but the service at this BJ’s was pretty bottom of the barrel! As a whole - we love the BJ’s Chain - we have been to many of them across the country, but this one was subpar for sure. And it was just the service or actually COMPLETE LACK OF - there were lots of people working - and the restaurant wasn’t very crowded - but about 90% of the employees here were just standing around in little groups chatting and playing with their cell phones! It was amazing! I think there was only one waitress in the entire restaurant that was working, everyone else was just looking at their phones and no one was getting service! It was terrible! Total lack of anything!!!

name: Matthew McArthur
text: Restaurant looks nice and seems set up ok but the staff are EXTREMELY unpleasant, unfriendly and just made the entire visit where we could not wait to finish the mediocre food and leave.

name: Shauna Calhoun
text: Oh this place was soo good! The service was also really good!

name: D Vincent
text: The menu is over 20 pages long of below average food. I wish they would cut the menu to maybe 5 pages and focus on making good dishes. I tried one of there brewed beer. I do not remember the name of it but it was just a lighter  bluemoon. The only good thing is the cookie

name: Nicole Nassar
text: This place is AWESOME! The menu is extensive. There is something for almost everyone here. Great mixed drinks and beer! The food was delicious! I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great place to eat!

name: Brad Bauer
text: The food here is excellent.  A lot of people eat here.  Not cheap, but quality comes at a price and they make real effort to make it the best it can be.  The bartender did order me one step larger pizza than I clearly specified but I just took the excess home.  Beer, liquor, and food selection is bar none and I know I can go there confidently!  I wouldn't have any doubt about going there again.

name: Bama Girl
text: Always love BJ's! Our waitress was awesome! She was so patient with our questions and very knowledgeable about the menu items and beverages. The food was delicious and beverages were spot on!

name: Angelica Sullivan
text: I ordered takeout from here for my children I haven't dined in, but from my view, this is a great place to sample different loggers. I noticed they have a zucchini noodle dish that looks great and low carb friendly. I got a chance to look at the menu and the food prices are reasonable and the selection is pretty good so go check this out.

name: AP
text: I loved the decor and ambience.  All we ordered was one of the pizookies, but it was so good!  Absolutely to die for.  The menu was huge, which is always a little worrisome, but I'd definitely try some of it.  The burgers looked good.

name: Latesha Johnson
text: If I could rate it at zero I would. After being there and waiting for about an hour, the 4 hamburgers and 1 kids pizza we ordered finally arrived at our table. The waitress told us the wait was because medium well hamburgers take longer to cook and they had to wait on the fresh fries. I've had steaks cooked to medium well that didn't take anywhere near that amount of time, but whatever. The hamburgers were all cold and one of them had mold on the bread. The waitress got the manager who apologized and made numerous excuses, she gave us a new order of boneless wings, but by that time we had been at this restaurant for almost 2 hours after a 6 hour road trip. The calamari we ordered also didn't have any flavor at all. After this disappointing and disgusting experience,the restaurant still handed us a $37.00 bill. We paid the bill and left hungry and feeling sick to our stomach due to the sight of mold on one of the buns. My son and I had taken a few bits out of our hamburgers, so hopefully we didn't unknowingly eat any moldy bread. Our experience at this restaurant was horrible and we will never go back there.

name: DAVID ROGERS
text: I had my first BJ'S this afternoon. Not pleased or impressed at all.  plates were ordered at my table, 2 burgers and a pasta, The burgers were ordered medium, but delivered well done. the bacon cheeseburger was not enjoyed. The Brisket loaded burger I recieved, had a cup full of BBQ with no Brisket. Now to the pasta, the person who eats anything, anywhere we go without complaint, had multiple negative comments. I have three to go boxes in my fridge or do you call those "Doggie Boxes"? Last, I did not order a specialty beer, but my domestic bottled beer was room temperature. Service was brought and asked twice by three different waitresses. Heard great things but tonight was a true disapointment.

name: Judith Reaves
text: Good variety of food choices. Had fun with 'flight' of beer, great way to sample!

name: Maurice Hall
text: It was so wonderful

name: Glenn Andrews
text: Great beer and food selection.  Reasonable prices. Nice atmosphere. Great service.

name: Christy Grant- Goens
text: Really good food and service! 10 out of 10, would definitely eat here again!

name: Carol Hunt
text: Service was good. Food was good. Beer was good. One issue in food delivery wrong meal served by a runner.

name: Emma Peace
text: Great selection of craft beer and menu items. A great place to go for huge variety that will please everyone in the family.

name: Melissa Strickland
text: Oh my goodness! This salad was delicious. This is the Roasted Brussel Sprout and Kale Salad with blackened Salmon. One of the best salads that I’ve had in a long time. Great thing about BJ’s is the diversity of the menu. No matter your taste or mood you can always find something to tickle your taste buds. Tons of menu options. Staff is always friendly and helpful. I will be ordering this again on my next visit!

name: Chuck Fuller
text: The menu has something for everyone. Seriously, if you can't find it here, you aren't hungry. The food is very good, the service is very good and pricing is also very good! Will visit the one that we have here in South Florida for Sure!

name: L Gunn
text: We were a large group and they made seating accommodations for us quickly.  It just took a really long time to get our food and it did not all come out together. The food was good, but we were there for more than 2-1/2 hours.

name: Christy Grant- Goens
text: Really good food and service! 10 out of 10, would definitely eat here again!

name: Chuck Fuller
text: The menu has something for everyone. Seriously, if you can't find it here, you aren't hungry. The food is very good, the service is very good and pricing is also very good! Will visit the one that we have here in South Florida for Sure!

name: Carmen Wilson
text: We have been here 3 times now. Each visit, we tried something different. Tonight it was the pizza. It was thin cracker type crust. And just enough flavor to leave you wanting more. Could have used a bit more of the  ingrefients. Had there been more staff, so we did not have to wait for service, not had dry glasses, or waited 15 minutes for dessert, it would have gotten a 5 star rating.

name: Ann Mayahi
text: BJs staff in Mobile off of Mobile were amazing! We are long time fans and know the food is always going to be fabulous! And today was no different!  When we got to our car it wouldn't start. Our 15 year old dog was with us and it was a 100 degrees outside. We asked for some water while we waited for AAA. they let us bring our dog into cool down and I was so thankful! They even brought her water@ I tried to give the lady a tip but she wouldn't take it! She was so kind and I so appreciated it! THANK YOU!

name: Maurice Hall
text: It was so wonderful

name: Kimberli Roberts
text: Great selection of foods to choose from both healthy and comfort food. It's nice to find a restaurant that stays open late or you can choose light healthy food. They offer small plates and do a great job preparing proteins. My entire party enjoyed their meals the portions are large and they have great service.

name: Wendall Wells
text: I would post 0 stars if available based upon a very bad experience at this location.

name: Keri M
text: Ate here a few times... always decent service .  Sat with Myles today .  Very funny and knowledgeable.  Had a great personality!  Food was good.

name: Emma Peace
text: Great selection of craft beer and menu items. A great place to go for huge variety that will please everyone in the family.

name: Taylor Livingston
text: We have eaten here several times and each time has been the same thing... Awesome food! Awesome drinks and great service! One of my new favorite restaurants.

name: Chris Search
text: Why would u go here?! Way over priced, terrible service. Go somewhere else

name: William Cunningham
text: Great place wonderful food

name: John Anderson
text: Price was fair and the menu was great. Had a bit of everything to appease anyone. Clean place great food and a friendly staff. Highly recommend it.

name: Michael Sanford
text: Had the deep dish pizza.  Food was good and service was excellent.  I am considered tough of tips sometimes and gave a $20 tip on a $60 bill.  Absolutely loved put waitress.

name: Jennifer Carter
text: Only thing good was the drink and salad, burger sucked.

name: Tink Dillard
text: My waiter,Cornell, was very welcoming & entertaining. I had a small issue with my salad which was fixed quickly. The manager,David, also made sure that we were pleased. I ordered the Parmesan crusted chicken & I must say it was delicious! I received a lot of food for the price. Overall it was a great first experience. I will be back!!!

name: Taylor Livingston
text: We have eaten here several times and each time has been the same thing... Awesome food! Awesome drinks and great service! One of my new favorite restaurants.

name: Scott Bordelon
text: Very, very overpriced! The food was awful! This was my second time eating here. I thought I’d try it again thinking that maybe it was just what I ordered the first time. The second time was just as bad! It was $73 for my wife and me to have dinner. We won’t be back!

name: Patrick Williams
text: Great dining experience! Our server helped with food and beer recommendations. We will definitely be frequenting this restaurant from now on.

name: Katie Corley
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to BJ's Brewhouse. The burgers were great as well as the salads! The staff were very friendly and our server had our order out in perfect time. We had their famous pizooki for dessert which are cookies and ice cream... BEST dessert ever! Definitely a must try when you visit!

name: Sally Land
text: I ordered the slow roasted chicken sandwhich togo which is Literally just Chicken, bacon, mayo, lettuce & tomato. I Asked for no tomato and light mayo. She repeated it back to me,twice. I get home and all that is on my sandwhich is a massive amount of mayo & chicken. Thats it. So I spent $12 on mayo and chicken. Waste of time and money.

name: Joann Brown
text: The place was pretty much empty when we arrived yet the services were so slow. It took forever for us to receive our food. When it finally did arrive it was horrible. My philly cheese steak tasted like the meat was substituted with old roast beef. Horrible experience from start to finish.

name: Terry Raines
text: Loved the pizza. Menu a little too big,but food looks good. A little pricey

name: LeAnn Withers
text: I absolutely LOVED this restraunt!!! This is a new favorite and will be going back for sure!!! I ordered the antipasto and spinach stuffed mushrooms, very happy with my choices! My fiance' ordered the bj hamburger and said it's the best one he's had in a long time! Sydney was our waitress and done a great job too! Oh and we don't drink alcohol either!

name: Charlotte Brown
text: Went the other night with a friend, they were out of a few liquors so I couldn't get the drink I wanted but the service and the food was AWESOME! The server was very knowledgeable of the menu and turned us onto a new drink. We had a blast and will be back soon!!!

name: Edward Schafer
text: Excellent selection of food and draft beer. Service was prompt and professional. If you are looking for good beer, great food, a relaxed atmosphere at a decent price B.J's is the spot.

name: Arlette Lee
text:
was surprised with a good choice of gluten free dishes.
brown rice dishes .
👍good tasting food.

name: Chris Gartman
text: The waitress was very un-attentive drop and go kind of attitude. Forgot our appetizer, I had  to ask another  waitress for my second drink. The spaghetti was okay and the chicken in the pasta was rock hard cooked. Not a very good experience for me!

name: Tracy Nicholas
text: I really didn't understand why the server gave bad service burger was dry she was dry just don't understand maybe they had a bad day well the tip was too

name: Lacy Kantra
text: This place is always great. I know it’s a chain but it never feels like one. I’ve never had any food I didn’t like there and service is always good. This time they were out of several beers I wanted, but that happens. We had the loaded potato skins and the chicken bacon ranch pizza. Very good. The dessert is always great too if you save room!

name: Lisa bishop
text: I'll never been here until last week. Food was delicious and was able to get in and out on lunch hour. Will definitely be back.

name: Toni Roder
text: Kayla was super friendly and helpful even though I can be. complicated customer. The drinks and food are always great and I highly recommend BJs to everyone.

name: Joshua Pirtle
text: Excellent food, service, and beer selection! If you are in the area I definitely recommend you drop by! Say hi to Chelsea tell her I sent you😉

name: *Chevy Meg*
text: The food was great, the prices were reasonable, and their brews are awesome! Our waiter Ivory L (sorry I didn’t catch your full name) was wonderful! We will definitely be back!

name: Monique Triplett
text: Although my reservations were not in the system,  the hostess was very nice and helped us as quickly as possible. But... our server was PHENOMENAL!! Even though we had a party of 8, he was in top of EVERYTHING!!!

name: Diamond Clopton
text: Missy was my server and not only was she the best host she kept a smile on her face and helped us with everything we needed. I would HIGHLY recommend Missy as a server for anyone. Even when she was busy she made a point to stop by our table to check on us and see if we needed anything.

name: Keith Harvey
text: Had a amazing experience when my wife and I dined tonight.  Our stuffed mushrooms were to die for.  Sharon had the sirloin steak which was not only cooked to perfection but could be cut with a fork.  I had the bison burger for the first time.  Moist and tasty.  Ended with dessert also over the top.  Our server Carla made a great experience  into a amazing first time visit.  The place was packed but we didn't feel neglected.   Guarantee won't be our last visit

name: Sean Carlton
text: Chain restaurant with friendly staff and consistently good pub fare. Great happy hour deals on their craft beer selection. Large menu has some variety including burgers, wings, pizzas, and sandwiches.

name: Scott Slatten
text: Good service, food was just above a buffet. Only been the one time may have just ordered the wrong thing, the plates going to other tables looked better than mine. Definitely going back when I can have a beverage, incredible selection of beers.

name: Chris Dufrene
text: Stellar food. Drink selection is great. That monkey bread dessert is fiya

name: Karen Gray
text: Would have been a five star except two in our party ordered the sirloin...both were extremely small and very little flavor. Needs to be bigger! All of the other meals were excellent, including the service.

name: Toni Roder
text: Kayla was super friendly and helpful even though I can be. complicated customer. The drinks and food are always great and I highly recommend BJs to everyone.

name: Deanna Chunn
text: Great atmosphere. I've only been once, the food was not good but the service and atmosphere were great. Friends that were with me that day said the food is normally good.

name: Robert Harper
text: This second time I have been to this restaurant. My first at the mobile location. The food was pretty good. I feel that the establishment in Jacksonville Fl was better but all and all I'd say this one is serviceable.

name: Sally Land
text: I ordered the slow roasted chicken sandwhich togo which is Literally just Chicken, bacon, mayo, lettuce & tomato. I Asked for no tomato and light mayo. She repeated it back to me,twice. I get home and all that is on my sandwhich is a massive amount of mayo & chicken. Thats it. So I spent $12 on mayo and chicken. Waste of time and money.

name: Marc McGuire
text: I'll start with there's plenty of different types of beer, the food selection is good, the staff is very friendly.

name: Julie Litzinger
text:
Food service was slow. Wait staff inexperienced.  No supervision of wait staff.
Pensacola is much better.

name: Kourtlyn Smith
text: Great food good place for a date upscale establishment. Rotating alcohol selection something new everytime I go.

name: Jennifer Mcilwain
text: That pizzoki though, however you spell it... 👌 I liked it. They have tons of different beers apparently and I liked their seating. Food took forever to come out though but I expected that because they were packed.

name: Sean Carlton
text: Chain restaurant with friendly staff and consistently good pub fare. Great happy hour deals on their craft beer selection. Large menu has some variety including burgers, wings, pizzas, and sandwiches.

name: Schuyler Powell
text: This place is cool the bartender is very average at one point I was super thirsty and she didn't notice that my glass was empty. But other than that this place is awesome and I don't have any other complaints easy five-star keep up the good work.

name: Marc McGuire
text: I'll start with there's plenty of different types of beer, the food selection is good, the staff is very friendly.

name: Eric Mercer
text: Great beer selection! Extensive menu...too large for me...but nice place. Would def return!

name: Kaitlyn Hinman
text:
Cindy was trash. Throw Cindy away. Cindy had no sense of service. My table of 4 had no silverware or napkins, that were asked for multiple times, for over an hour, and were not received until after our entrees arrived. And that's just part of it. ((-:

I didn't even feel bad about not tipping. I have NEVER not tipped. I've been a waitress, even when its busy and certain things are out of your control, it's not hard to get what you can of your job done, and to communicate AT THE LEAST with your customers.

so, again I say, Cindy is trash.

name: Frank Lee
text: This Brewhouse is a welcome change Mobile Alabama. The food is swiftly prepared and brought to the table fresh with a delightful Italian Flair. The staff is knowledgeable about the food and it's menu is diverse enough to allow any family dinner night to be a delight a definite must try

name: Kourtlyn Smith
text: Great food good place for a date upscale establishment. Rotating alcohol selection something new everytime I go.

name: Deon Smith
text: The best thing I ever had best ribs  and the fries and u have to come over to this place

name: Gary Pearcy
text: First time visit but won't be last. Food was some of the best anywhere. I had the double Bone Pork Chop and it might have been the best thing that I have ever eaten. Service was good.

name: Apothion
text: Would have been a really good place except we called 4 hours early about having nearly 30 of us and when we went they would not  set one more addtional table at the end of ours so four of our friends had to sit separately in a booth somehwere.

name: jodie robbins
text:
Customer service was great. Food was fresh
Prices were good.

name: Chris Camp
text: The restaurant as a whole is very nice.  There is a huge selection of menu items to choose from and of the two times I've been both meals I've chosen were very good.  However the wait staff were 50/50.  First time I went it was a very poor impression, but the second time our server was on point (different server from the first).

name: Star Chevrolet
text:
Had high hopes for this place.  Brew house is great.  Good quality beers.  Our server was great.  There seems to be an issue in the kitchen.  Wrong food.  Burnt food. We didn’t pay for our food but ya can’t really run a business this way.

We chalked it up to a bad day but even our server said they have been screwing up orders all day.

name: Jim Merritt
text: Delicious from salads to burgers. Everyone in our group was happy.

name: Mary Jackson
text: Ever time I been to this place  I have enjoyed my food and good service fast and food is hot

name: Jennifer Mcilwain
text: That pizzoki though, however you spell it... 👌 I liked it. They have tons of different beers apparently and I liked their seating. Food took forever to come out though but I expected that because they were packed.

name: Ashley Ashworth
text: There are so many options, and everything I've tried is so good. The staff was super friendly and even helped by recommending dishes and drinks. I am definitely going back.

name: Elise U
text: Very slow service. It took over an hour to get food. The burger was not very good but the tacos, chicken sandwich, and ribs were decent. Selection of alcohol was the best part of course.

name: Millie Tizol
text: I love their brussels sprouts! The service was excellent and the food was very good.

name: Deanna Chunn
text: Great atmosphere. I've only been once, the food was not good but the service and atmosphere were great. Friends that were with me that day said the food is normally good.

name: Johnnie Parks
text: The service was pleasing and the waitress went above and beyond to please us.

name: Kaitlyn Hinman
text:
Cindy was trash. Throw Cindy away. Cindy had no sense of service. My table of 4 had no silverware or napkins, that were asked for multiple times, for over an hour, and were not received until after our entrees arrived. And that's just part of it. ((-:

I didn't even feel bad about not tipping. I have NEVER not tipped. I've been a waitress, even when its busy and certain things are out of your control, it's not hard to get what you can of your job done, and to communicate AT THE LEAST with your customers.

so, again I say, Cindy is trash.

name: Fred Jones II
text: The best food in Mobile Alabama. This location is not cheap, but the restaurant serves a large portion of food. There extremely pepperoni gluten-free pizza is amazing along with the warm chocolate chip cookie and ice cream.

name: Jauan D. Knight
text: Came with a party of 8, being reasonable, I understand a party is hard to sit. However the Staff was SO rude. They didn’t want to seat us and had a lot of issues after we sat down. Food was great though 🤷🏾‍♂️.

name: Elise U
text: Very slow service. It took over an hour to get food. The burger was not very good but the tacos, chicken sandwich, and ribs were decent. Selection of alcohol was the best part of course.

name: Tim McGowan
text: Get the steak cooked medium well. Also do not leave here without eating a Pizookie!

name: Kat Cline
text: Food is pretty good and the service was good but the allergy menus are super hard to navigate. They have a gluten free bun but then none of the burgers are marked as gluten free so you don't know about individual ingredients unless you ask which is super frustrating for both the customer.and the server. No gluten free beer; there is a couple ciders but it's not the same. Not bad for an occasional spot to change things up but corporate definitely needs to work on the menu. When I tried to email and explain how it could be improved, they forwarded the email to the local store and told me I could talk to manager. I appreciate the local managers attpt to help but I don't want a 20 min discussion every time I place an order when there are easier ways to make the menus more concise.

name: Johnnie Parks
text: The service was pleasing and the waitress went above and beyond to please us.

name: Stephen DeAngelo
text: Food was good. The menu was very large. Almost too large

name: Jim Merritt
text: Delicious from salads to burgers. Everyone in our group was happy.

name: Jennifer Mccall
text: Bjs enlightenment meals are.  You should try the lemon time chicken soooo good.  One Mondays you can a large gourmet pizza for half price. They are worth every penny. Tuesday 3 dollars pizookie comes with ice cream.

name: Andrew Anastasia
text: Food was okay, it was served to me after the entire party was done eating though. I had to ask three times to get my dessert. Probably won't go back

name: Jim Mauldin
text: It was excellent and our waitress. Shanna, took great care of us!!!!

name: Wayne Brinkley
text: The service was very slow. Slow to be seated even though no one was ahead of us. The pizza and the wings were overcooked. Too bad. I usually like BJ’s

name: Kat Cline
text: Food is pretty good and the service was good but the allergy menus are super hard to navigate. They have a gluten free bun but then none of the burgers are marked as gluten free so you don't know about individual ingredients unless you ask which is super frustrating for both the customer.and the server. No gluten free beer; there is a couple ciders but it's not the same. Not bad for an occasional spot to change things up but corporate definitely needs to work on the menu. When I tried to email and explain how it could be improved, they forwarded the email to the local store and told me I could talk to manager. I appreciate the local managers attpt to help but I don't want a 20 min discussion every time I place an order when there are easier ways to make the menus more concise.

name: Woody Myers
text: So good. Love the craft beers. Wait staff is great. Menu is HUGE, so many choices. Great experience. A must go see.

name: Thomas Querbach
text:
First time, and the last. Had the pulled turkey dip, and my GF had a Philly steak sandwich.  Both sandwiches that were brought out, and both the turkey and the steak were not cooked thoroughly. Our sandwich meat was lukewarm on the outside, and cold in the middle. Also, both meats were dry. It looked like they cooked our order and left it under a food heat lamp for a long period of time or threw it in the microwave and nuked it poorly.

Highly disappointed when when this place was a recommendation from several friends. Never coming here again, nor would recommend this place to anyone.

name: Elle J.
text: I love BJ's because of the late hours and they offer gluten free meals and desserts.

name: Justin Baxter
text: Always good food and beer. Beer is outrageously expensive though. Almost 9 dollars for some of their beer.

name: Garrett Smith
text: Wonderful Dinner and Drinks!!

name: Jauan D. Knight
text: Came with a party of 8, being reasonable, I understand a party is hard to sit. However the Staff was SO rude. They didn’t want to seat us and had a lot of issues after we sat down. Food was great though 🤷🏾‍♂️.

name: Christy Johnson
text: The food was excellent 👌 and the service was good.  If you are in the area that has one, please stop and enjoy yourself.

name: Delana Casler
text:
My family of 6 have frequented BJ’s a dozen times or more and have absolutely enjoyed our experience each trip. The large menu has such a wide variety of food that allows everyone in our family to find something they enjoy, but it’s the service we receive each time that has made the decision to return a no brainer for my husband and I.

On our most recent visit last week, Kayana was our server and provided the same great service we have come to expect from BJ’s. She was a joy and provided prompt service with genuine care and attention. Kayana spoke to each of our children, offered meal suggestions, and kept my thirsty crew’s drinks filled on top of bringing her positive energy to our day.

We appreciate you, Kayana and all of the great BJ’s servers. Thank you for giving us great dinner experiences time and time again!

name: Dl Linse
text: Great food. Excellent service. Highly recommend

name: Nancy Sherrer
text: Treated my granddaughter  and family to dinner here, very good, leaving her at college there--sad🙄!

name: jennifer sawyer
text: BJ's has one of largest selection of menu items in Mobile that range from a basic burger to a healthy lemon thyme chicken dish. Some dishes offer a small tweak to classic favorites, think spicy spaghetti and meatballs, or try something completely new like cherry Chipotle glazed salmon. Prices are reasonable and the quality is great.

name: Stephanie Mills
text: Wonderful food and friendly service staff!

name: John Bolton
text: I'm from Oklahoma and I was so excited to see they added one to Mobile, AL. the food is always amazing and the waitrss we had was just as amazing.

name: mark christianson
text: 2nd largest menu in the country, they claim.  It is a huge tome of a menu, I'll give them that.  Good place to take large group- variety=something for everyone. Interesting beer offerings. We usually start our order w/ "these nerds crave cheese curds." My kid hasn't met a pizzookie he didn't like

name: Ronda Daugherty
text: Food was delicious and the service was great. Also I loved all the options we had to choose from

name: Cindy Stirngfellow
text: The service was great, the entree I ordered was not that great. And the sweet tea was extremely to sweet.

name: Rebecca Brown
text: Service was very good. We had a great service. Food I can honestly say for the first time wasn't good. My jambalaya was so spicy I couldn't eat it. But this is the first time it wasn't good.

name: Cindy S
text:
Our waiter was very courteous and interesting to talk with during our Supper.  I had grilled broccoli and kale salad with strawberry vingerette topped with grilled salmon. The salmon was a little overcooked but still enjoyable.  Lots of people there and atmosphere was pleasant and clean.
Sorry I forgot to take pictures.
Oh, yes....I would go again.

name: Kimberly Diane Rouse
text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Mobile.  Their specialties are burgers & pizzas.  We ordered the prime rib.  Not tender enough for hubby so they swapped it  out for the rib eye.  OMG! It was delicious!  We inhaled it so quickly I was unable to take a pic!  The berry burst cider is the bomb too!  Gotta try it!

name: Scott Vicknair
text:
Regular BJ's restaurant customer amongst the establishments.

One bartender for a busy night. Poor her.
The Manager is clueless to have one bartender. Ordered a margarita with patron silver yet watched from a distance the bartender pour house tequila. Food is decent.
Anyway, take care and best of luck. Won't be back.

name: Erin Smith
text: Food was fantastic, except my grandmother was served raw bacon. When she showed the waitress the raw bacon she came back out with cooked bacon and slammed it on the table beside her and had an attitude. She also walked past our check several times and acted like she didn't see the check even though she reached over it to pick up our plates and looked at it each time she walked by. Overall food was wonderful but the service is questionable. IF I go back I will request a different waitress.

name: K D
text: Great specials! Friendly staff. Food is pretty good and they have an extensive food & beverage menu to choose from. Something for everyone.

name: Ernesto
text: The service was awesome and attentive. Place is really nice. They took a while with our food, but we actually arrived half an hour before closing, so that's ok. The food was really good, except for the unusually spicy charred asparagus (we don't eat too spicy food).

name: Alex Grady
text: Our service was fast and friendly and the food was great! A chain restaurant with some style and a gigantic menu, normally not a good thing but they seemd quite capable of handling all of the different fare with ease.

name: Leonard Smith
text: The steak had too much pepper. The floor was slick, like it hadn't been properly cleaned. Our server wasn't on her game neither. On the other hand, the pork chop was excellent.

name: Frank Cornman
text: This place has good food but for a $15 chicken sandwich you would expect something more than a 4 oz. peice of chicken. You would get twice as much from chick fil le. The food is tasty,  the beer was cold but expect way more for what you pay for. Manager even told me I was the 2nd person to send back my chicken sandwich. Waitress was on point at beginning but later on hardly saw her. Don't know if it was me sending back first sandwich or what?

name: E.S. Turner Wilson
text:
Good food, drinks & Atmosphere. Big Restaurant with all amenities. Casual.
Reservations usually not needed.

name: Mike Adams
text: Good food and great service. Flexible menus.

name: Vinny Buonora
text: Good atmosphere, good brew. $4 BJs beers on Wednesday’s! Food was okay, not a lot of flavor. Waitress was pushy and gave check early. First thing she asked was if we wanted tea or lemonade. Insisted on appetizers. Did NOT offer a second round of drinks. Pricey meals $$$

name: Brian Collins
text: Nice variety of foods good boys or girls night out

name: Annie Smith
text: I had a great experience at BJ's in Mobile. It was my first time there. Genesis sat me, explained the menu items, and was very nice and engaging. I will definitely be back.

name: John Humphries
text: I went here some time ago, didn't like it, thought I'd try again.  The chimicurri chicken was good but small, the sweet potato fries were greasy as was the bland avocado eggroll.  The fresh sauted greenbeans were good and so was the perfect Patron margarita which did not taste like preservative.  The menu is so extensive i'm sure there must be good items somewhere and i'm willing to keep looking.

name: mr G
text: This place is delicious and they have good drinks.  Ive been a couple times and will definitely go back!

name: Barbara Kibler McCleskey
text: Was anxious to try BJ's out but our party of 11 seemed to be to much for them... we were told we would have a 50 min wait, so after waiting 45 min we asked the hostess for an update and she quickly snapped back  and told us we had only been waiting 36 min... sooo with that reply we decided they were not getting our business!  Having not eaten a bite there, this experience let me with a bad taste in my mouth! We won't be back..

name: Alex Almond
text: I am typically more harsh on the criticism of a chain styled restaurant, but BJs still ranks very well to me. They may not be #1, but if you have a party of 6 and one wants a good burger, one a steak, one fish, one pizza and the rest don't know - this is the place that makes everyone happy.

name: MB Ferguson
text: service and beer not quite in order... appetizer was good. We were interested in a full evening of dinner and drinks;yet, the service..not just the server..was so disorganized and unsupervised that we left quickly.

name: Jarred Jackson
text: Server was never around, food came out cold, my boy never got his fries after telling the waitress he never recieved them. Just an all around garbage hole that I will not be returning to. One friend ordered steak and it was super dry. Waste of money

name: carley treubig
text: service was great!!! waitresses were very attentive & happy to be there. food came out fast & hot & was delicious I got the deep dish baked ziti & it was awesome! they were even giving people some sample appetizers while they waited for a table! I recommend!!

name: christina t
text: Friendly and active waitresses. Nice aesthetics.

name: Patricia Mslisham
text: The service was fantastic.   This young lady provided us with lots of personal attention.

name: Rob Moles
text: Rating this dinner as a one star was being generous.  This restaurant is located in the old cheddar's location and it would have been better if they took the hint and left it closed.  The table was filthy and the floor underneath it had more food on it then what was served to me on my plate.  The long island ice tea was pure sour mix with a splash of alcohol which was sent back without drinking it.  I spoke to the manager and I still got charged 10 dollars for the drink.  Don't waste your time or money here especially if your taking someone you actually care about.

name: Andres Rangel
text: Good place if you are looking varieties of beer. Good for hamburgers and seafood lovers.

name: Janice Autrey
text: This was my first time but not my last. Too many choices to try. Oh my goodness

name: Terry Allen
text: Excellent service and delectable, sinfully good desserts particularly the pizookies! I'm from the Birmingham area and was visiting my daughter who's a student at "South". I can't wait until I go back to Mobile to dine again at BJ's!

name: Steven D
text: Huge menu with a decent craft beer selection.

name: troy parnell
text: I love this restaurant.  Delicious food, fair prices and they have daily specials.  I like half off pizza Mondays the best.

name: bobby jiles
text: The lemon butter salmon was pretty good just needed a little salt added

name: Queenie C
text: My husband and I came to this restaurant and waited 10 minutes to be seated as a party of  two. The hostess didn't even acknowledge us.  A party of six walked in after we had been waiting and the hostess spoke to them and attempted to seat them immediately.  My husband is Caucasian and I am African American.  The party that entered after us was Caucasian. My husband and I feel that we were racially discriminated against.    I work for a major airline.  My husband and I travel all over the world.  This is the first time we've experienced such blatant racism.  I'm extremely disgusted and disappointed in this company.  The type of employees the company hires speaks volumes about the character of its establishment.  I will never give BJ's my business again.

name: Mary Johnson
text: I love this place great service and fabulous food! I will definitely go back their menu is so huge I can't wait to get started!

name: Nina Hamman
text: Huge selection of beers, good food and their handcrafted orange cream soda was yummy.

name: Patrick Summerlin
text: Good food, and a large variety to pick from. Also a beer drinker's paradise.

name: Cindy Maddox
text: First and last time to eat at BJ's.  All I can say is the food was horrible and I'm out $13 for lunch.  Will not go back!

name: Willie Hill
text: Food was not good this time since they reopened

name: Big A TOWN Yep
text: Love the salmon dish

name: tracy rhamy
text: Ive tried this place 3 different times. I would have to say i WONT be back.. all 3 times the service is the worse..i barely seen our server her name was Darnisha. She Never refilled our beverages..its my own fault i dudnt say anything but my order was completely wrong i think she struggles with the ipad and ringing in food..you think a good server would have realized when i touched none of my food something was wrong...she was more concerned with cleaning up and getting us out....i didn't complain because it had already been over 45 mints which made no sense because your restaurant was almost EMPTY. It takes way to long for food  ...food sucks ... service sucks ... i definitely wont be back  tried 3 times and u cannot seem to get it together.....

name: Caitlyn Owens
text: Food was delicious, wish they had more dessert options

name: Tammy Hamrick
text: Brought my boyfriend here for dinner for his birthday. He had the bison burger and said it was awesome. I had the Chicken Parm with cheddar mashed potatoes.  It was the best chicken parm without red sauce I have ever had. Our serve recommended it and he was right.

name: Traci Griswold
text: Always the best food and the best service!  Cherry glazed salmon or Peruvian quinoa bowl are the best. And April T. will treat you like the only person in the world that matters!   Its amazing!

name: Shannon Richardson
text: Good food.  The service wasn't the best.  I kind of got ignored and another staff member brought my food out.

name: suzanne tranfaglia
text: Amazing menu and craft brews! Try the nutty brewnette! The barbecue bison burger was very good!

name: Janice Autrey
text: This was my first time but not my last. Too many choices to try. Oh my goodness

name: Steven D
text: Huge menu with a decent craft beer selection.

name: Gordon Sanders
text: Ambiance is great, food and service not up to the standard for the prices.  1st visit, we'll see if they improve.  1 down two chances to go.

name: James
text: Delicious food but never on time

name: Percido Mejia
text: This one will open April 03, 2017.  I have been to other BJ'S in the country and am never let down. Great beers, and great food. And the desserts are awesome!!!

name: John Humphries
text: I went here some time ago, didn't like it, thought I'd try again.  The chimicurri chicken was good but small, the sweet potato fries were greasy as was the bland avocado eggroll.  The fresh sauted greenbeans were good and so was the perfect Patron margarita which did not taste like preservative.  The menu is so extensive i'm sure there must be good items somewhere and i'm willing to keep looking.

name: Max McGill
text:
moderate prices, great inhouse brews,  excellent selection of craft drafts, eclectic & large menu. something for everyone.
will take several visits to sample a fraction of goodies available . can't wait.

name: Necia Nicholas
text: Chain. Good food. A few good beers

name: Auron181
text: So the food was amazing and the drinks were excellent my only complaint was my server walked away from me while i was asking for condiments. Besides that it was a wonderful experience.

name: Pamela Waleri
text: The steak was good but the flat bread chicken pizza was horrible. Over cooked & left under the heat lamp too long. Ughhhhhhhh.

name: Rob Coy
text: Wow!  My new favorite burger place!  The fries are awesome too!  I think I'll try the steak next time.

name: Kendall Duke
text: I usually like this place, however my experiences with them has been horrible through waitr. It takes them 20+ minutes just to start preparing the food. Today when I received my food I did not like that the roll was thrown in with the Alfredo. It was soggy and I threw it away. Additionally, there was a hair in the pasta which was enclosed inside the to go container, as well as the plastic bag so I know it was not the waitr drivers. Paying $27 dollars for a bowl of pasta with hair and a roll slopped in the alfredo sauce is outrageous.

name: MDP
text: One of the best BJ's I ever been too.

name: Randall Dimoff
text: BJ's Restaurant was very nice! Wait staff could have had more personnel on floor to assist with orders.

name: Sam Mayes
text: I got the Thursday special which was a tri-tip entre and it came with a pizookie. I really liked the bbq steak. A lot more than I thought I would and the caramel pizookie was to die for.

name: Chris Taylor
text: Great food. Great service! Prime Rib is awesome!

name: Kattie schweighart Schweighart
text:
Food was Great Our waitress was awesome.
I will be back. In May. ♥️

name: Bob Broach
text: Good food, good craft beers! Service was excellent.

name: msnycc33
text: We were looking for dinner and this place being open late night was right up our alley. They were closing at 1am and we got there about 2hrs prior to them closing. Because we've never been there before we didn't really know what we wanted so it took us about 15mins to decide in between watching the game highlights. In that time the waiter Brian(Tall guy, will make my point in a min)came back 3 separate times once with my drink and by the third time we were ready. I ordered my meal and had to speak loudly for him to hear me instead of him stooping down to hear me(1st star strike). Instead of addressing my date to what he was ordering he kept looking at me expecting me to rely the order(2nd star strike). So Chicken Alfredo was ordered with a request to add shrimp and pizza. When our order came it was obvious the waiter didn't care to do QC because there was no chicken in the "Chicken" Alfredo. I went to hand him the plate to take back and he waved me off saying "no, he can start eating that and I'll bring the chicken back" and walked away. Please tell me what's the point of ordering a entree to be prepared a specific way and then eating it made incomplete?... Then he comes back and says it will be 10mins for the chicken. Why did he bring back chopped up chicken in a little sauce dip cup. My date said not to worried about it, but I'm like this isn't worth the price. We end up asking for to go boxes and he dropped the check. When he returned with the boxes a couple mins later, he stated he would take the check now and proceed to stand over me as I looked in my purse. I guess I was taking too long for him because he felt to suggest I sit my purse on the table so I can see. I advised I didn't need any assistance and never felt soo rushed to pay the bill(3rd star strike). No we didn't want dessert, my date didn't even eat his meal, but maybe I was going to order another Topical Island(which was fruit juice with a splash of liquor, nope I'll pass). Rude service in a half empty establishment is a no go for me.  Don't worry we won't be back.

name: Melissa Rhyne
text: Pricier than comparable restaurants but wonderful atmosphere.

name: Traci Griswold
text: Always the best food and the best service!  Cherry glazed salmon or Peruvian quinoa bowl are the best. And April T. will treat you like the only person in the world that matters!   Its amazing!

name: Mason
text: The staff was extremely helpful and friendly but my visit was during a soft-open reservation event so that's not surprising. What was surprising was their low quality burger. I ordered one of four dishes available to our table, which was a Portobello burger. It had the consistency of the kind of burger you guy frozen from a place like Sam's or Costco. It was dry, very uniform in shape, overcooked and lacked much flavor. The building itself is nice and new but since this is a restaurant I have to rate with a focus on food, which this time, was very poor.

name: Eric Bragg
text: Lots of choices on the menu, moderate prices... great food!

name: Calvin Porter
text: Always stop at a BJs whenever possible. Their beers are cold and the selection is large. Everything we have ever eaten at a BJs has been very good. Don't try their Pazookie...or you will be HOOKED...WOW. How good is a Pazookie..yum.

name: Tammy Hamrick
text: Brought my boyfriend here for dinner for his birthday. He had the bison burger and said it was awesome. I had the Chicken Parm with cheddar mashed potatoes.  It was the best chicken parm without red sauce I have ever had. Our serve recommended it and he was right.

name: Davida Ashley
text: I had the blood orange sangria... Minus the cinnamon stick because they ran out. Lovely crowd. Seemed busy

name: carla pennington
text: Food is delicious. Staff always nice and helpful. Prices are reasonable

name: Sara Bradley
text: Love those ribs.  Service is great.

name: Jessica Smith
text: Delicious food. There are so many amazing choices. Great service.

name: Marcie Cameron
text: Service was good but the food was only OK.

name: Josh Peel
text: Happy hour has some banging deals. Bar tender was kind of a cold though.

name: Sean Mulholland
text: Absolute joke. Ordered prime rib, waited an hour, yes, a full hour before they said they were out. Told them to just bring the rest of the families food which was cold! Then they said dinner was on them, then still charged me for everyone elses! 2 hours later, we left and will never be back. Manager came over but ne er checked again, water was finally filled once right before we left. Wow

name: Syed Bokhari
text: Some items are just not worth it. But good place to eat with friends

name: Wendy Slaughter
text: Delicious food and very sweet waitress!  Loved the authentic Italian!

name: Carolyn Mai
text: Horrible experience.  Waitress wasn't focus. Keep forgetting us. Utensils was dirty so we ask to have them replace, got our food and she never gave us our utensils so we ate with  our hand. Good thing it was figure food but still.... if we want utensils, we should have them. Food was NASTY. Fries was soggy and the wrap we got was a MESS.. total experience for my 1st time there 👎👎👎👎👎

name: Gordon Sanders
text: Ambiance is great, food and service not up to the standard for the prices.  1st visit, we'll see if they improve.  1 down two chances to go.

name: Katie Crabtree
text:
Loved it! Great atmosphere and absolutely delicious food and great variety of appetizers  entrees  and desserts that was just dinner
lunch menu looks just as delicious

name: Reese Tatum
text: My friends and I went here for the first time last night. It will definitely also be my last. The restaurant was fairly full but we were seated quickly. However, after a few minutes we noticed the floor beneath our table was covered in food and water. We moved tables but this restaurant was just disgusting in general. The menus were sticky and had food on them. The hostess forgot to bring us silverware and finally did after about 20 minutes. My friend's napkin was dirty and had a stain on it. Our waitress messed up our drink orders. She was very slow and unfriendly. Ordered spinach-artichoke dip for appetizer and it barely flavorful and very watery. Food was subpar. Friend ordered steak and it was very dry and slightly burnt. The menu is entirely too big. They would be better off with a simple menu and focus on quality food. Only giving two stars because I did enjoy the atmosphere and they had a great drink selection. I may return for a brew, but I won't waste my money on anymore of their food.

name: Slim 1998
text: Great environment and a great meal too. I am definitely goinh back very soon.

name: christine drinkard
text: Mandy, our server, was fantastic as was the food. Steak and Burger perfectly cooked.

name: Percido Mejia
text: This one will open April 03, 2017.  I have been to other BJ'S in the country and am never let down. Great beers, and great food. And the desserts are awesome!!!

name: Incognitoria Anonymousita
text:
The food was mediocre and overpriced, it took forever for our food to arrive, and our waitress "D" was very rude and incompetent. (incompetent means-not having or showing the necessary skills to do something successfully) She did not get our order right, she did not do her job successfully the first time...displaying incompetence.

1st waitress ERROR-My food arrived way before everyone else's so I was eating and no one else had food. My beef: She works there and should understand how things work and how long it takes for different foods to be prepared and common sense says that no one wants to sit and watch everyone else eat. I know you might be thinking-what if she was new? Nope she was not knew. She was not asking anyone questions and she was not shadowing another waiter/waitress.

KITCHEN-It took foreeeeever for the remaining food items to come out and they were not busy. It was not slow, but it was not so busy that a person would look around and think it was going to take a while before the food came. There were many empty parking spaces and we were seated immediately.

2nd waitress ERROR-When the remaining food items FINALLY came out one food order was WRONG. She argued with me about what I asked for and although she took the food back she did so in a huff and grudgingly so.
Kitchen-Again we had to wait a loooooong time for the final food item to come out. When she brought the fixed food back the toppings were sparse in comparison to the first one. Time stamps on our receipts prove that it took forever. The time between placing our order (when the order was put in) and receiving our ticket (shortly after receiving the final sparse food item) was 2 1/2 hours.

3rd waitress ERROR-When she brought the check she "apologized", but it was terse, gruff, grudgingly done, and quickly mumbled. The biggest thing is the WAY she worded it to make it seem as though it were my fault that SHE got our order wrong. She said "sorry for your miscommunication". I was calm and kept my comments to myself. I was not rude and we tipped her well, because we are Christians and that is what we do. In my head and speaking with my husband my thoughts went more like: Really lady! It is your job, your goal, your mission, the REASON you get PAID = to take the customer's order right and get it right...the FIRST time!

4th waitress ERROR-she did NOT repeat the order back. If she was CONFUSED about my request then she should have clarified BEFORE placing the order. Again part of her job and if she can't do her job properly then she needs to find other work.

The food was mediocre and overpriced, it took FOREVER for our food to arrive, and our waitress was very rude and incompetent (incompetent means-not having or showing the necessary skills to do something successfully). We will not be back and we would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

name: Paige Lindsey
text: We sat at the bar with the bartender Ashley. She was very knowledgable when we were looking for something to drink. My husband loves to drink ambers and she told him that bjs made a great amber called oasis, she let him sample the beer and he was in love! I ended up getting an old fashion with woodford and she hands down made the best old fashion I've ever had. She continued to give us a small tour of the menu (which is giant) but gives plenty to desire. We proceeded to get the avacado egg rolls (her recommendation) and we absolutely loved them. Following the appetizer we got the ribeye, cooked to perfection, and the Mediterranean tacos (I was torn between those and the mahi tacos.) the manager Chelsea stopped by the bar and spoke to us, she was very nice and professional and asked us how our experience was. We decided to write a review to let the manager know that we thoroughly enjoyed our experience and will be back in to sit with Ashley! We have since been in multiple times with the best experiences. My husband and I recommend sitting at the bar, faster service and great conversation!

name: daméon hudson
text:
Do you ask for Chelsea Prince "great customer service" at the bar! Allow this to be the first review and they're not even open. If you like great craft beer this will be your favorite place in Mobile.. it's an upscale bar with excellent food and a huge selection of housemaid genres of beers along with many Imports. I have visited this company many times in Texas and am proud to have it in Mobile which is my new home. I'm very excited and hope you enjoy yourself there.

(Okay... open on invite only) so B.J.s is still the same classy bar I knew it as. Mobile. Don't be hesitant on trying a dark beer. BJ's house Porter called BJ's PM Porter (ABV 5.5%) is smooth and decadent in a 16 Oz pour. It's also cost-effective. The BJ'S Tatonka Stout is 8.5% ABV in a 11oz glass is plenty to get to you in the right spot!

Try anything with frys. Believe me they are best. You have never seen a frys like it. It appears to have no seasoning at all but clearly it you're going to ask how they did that. :) You will notice you have not even dipped the frys in ketchup yet and there half gone. They are that good.

You are treated with class here. Servers pay attention to your every need. There appears to be good leadership here and it shows through the employees.

text: Horrible experience! Walked in sat there over 50 mins and no one came to our table. But as soon as another couple came in they went to their table less than 10 mins

name: Sasha Thatcher
text: We waited about 25 minutes for a table which I thought was reasonable considering it's Friday night and the restaurant opened just 3 weeks ago. The staff was friendly. I ordered a flight of beer and got the 4 darkest beer. All were pretty good. We got chips and queso verde as an appetizer and the queso was great, the chips were good and not very salty. We had the up all night burger and deep dish baked ziti. The burger was great and the fries were crispy and seasoned. The ziti was good, the meatballs were spicy and there was a nice balance of cheese and sauce. The menu is very large, there are quite a few things I'd like to try.

name: Sugalumps
text:
My family was invited to the soft opening today. They open on Monday, April 3rd. The service that we had was fantastic.
We had Sriracha Queso and Piranha Pale Ale Chili appetizer. It was great to start us out. The kids loved it.
We did a taster of flights for the beers. Berry Burst Cider, Tatanka Stout, and Jeremiah Red were great choices. BJ's has handcrafted sodas too. They brought us a sampler of the sodas when we said that should be on the menu.
Our entrees options were Mahi Mahi tacos, Turkey Burger, Deep dish Pizza, and Honey Crisp salad. Tacos were great, Turkey Burger was juicy, but the deep dish left a little to be desired. I finished off my meal with a handcrafted root beer float that was phenomenal.
We will definitely recommend our friends and family to eat here. I will be back to try the Root Beer Ribs after the opening.

name: Chelsea Pirtle
text:
Grand Opening Day
April 3, 2017
We are very excited to be in Mobile, AL!

name: Charles Callari
text: Today for lunch I had the brisket sandwich. I 100% recommend this sandwich. Get ready because it’s a little messy but really worth the mess. If you like brisket then you should definitely Get this sandwich. I also had fries which were nice and hot. Next to McDonald’s fries, these are my favorite. If you are in the BHAM downtown area then you should stop her for a quick lunch. We were in and out of there within 45 minutes.

resp.text: Hey Charles. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Sasha Elhaiga
text: I've never had a problem coming to this location. Since it is so close to UAB campus, my friends and I come here quite a lot. Hot food fast with lots of sports games to watch. Very good customer service and drink options. All around a good time!

resp.text: Hey Sasha. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

text: Waitress Melissa was new BUT SHE IS BEST SERVER EVER!I got sick she helped me out getting me a wet towel for my face and  ginger ale...the combo app was great and pulled brisket was ok dry but need extra bbq sauce.. But they took GREAT CARE OF US..I WILL BE BACK

resp.text: Hey Nakisha. Thanks for the feedback! Hope to see you again soon!

name: Shir Carson
text: Saturday afternoon, 15 -20 min wait, flew by the ambiance in door and outdoor was live. Our server was was great, recommended several items on the menu. We tried the Baked pretzels with queso cheese dip and Honey mustard dip. Ordered the chicken sandwich with french fries and the Brisket and Double burger  with potato wedges. Sprite, water, and Mojito for drinks. the food was served hot, everything was fresh and juicy, seasoned well too! We will be back! Had a great time!

resp.text: Hey Shir. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

name: Danny Neaves
text: This particular location is great, plenty of parking, some free, some are metered. The facility is top notch and very nice. It is a new facility (as of February 2020) but it goes beyond that it is just a well done space and they stay busy. I've been as early as 11:15 and as late as 12:30 and it is usually very busy. The staff is good and the food is good too. This chain has become a little pricey over the last couple of years, but we enjoy it every time we go. I've been to this location with 3 people and with 6 people and both times we were able to sit quickly even though they were busy. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a quick lunch, they can get you in and out.

name: Lemondria Thomas
text: This location us a lot better than the one in hoover. Customer service was much better and the food is good as always.

resp.text: Hey Lemondria. Thanks for the kind words. Hope to see you again soon!

text: Now hiring is real.  The waitress was tired and we could tell it.  This was my first time ordering wings. The plain wings aren't on the menu for a reason they definitely need sauce.  I will stick with their burgers which are very good.

name: Hello Terry
text: I ordered my lunch online and went straight to the restaurant about 5 minutes away by car.  The staff was pleasant.  I paid for my food and waited in the van for my co-worker to pay for his food.  As I waited I looked into my bag to inspect my lunch and eat a few fries.  The fries were hard and lukewarm at best.  I go back in and ask for fresher fries which they obliged by taking my entire lunch back and putting the "fresh fries" in my clamshell.  After returning to the office to eat; the parmesan garlic chicken nuggets were obviously not fried to order.  They were dry and barely warm as well.  Every time I've gone to BWW this has been the case whether dining in or carry out.  I think they cook everything in bulk and its never fresh or hot when it reaches the table.  In my dine-in experiences bone-in wings are never cooked to order and always seem like they're been sitting under a heat lamp and brought out to the table.  I will not go to another BWW again; food is just not done right and is never good!!

resp.text: Hey there. We apologize for the food you received…thanks for letting us know. Please fill out the form at the bottom of BuffaloWildWings.com/FAQ where it says 'Orders & Visits' so we can make it right for you.

The chicken had so many feathers, I couldn't even enjoy . I ordered kids meals for my girls both of which were supposed to have a drink that we didn't receive, and also their order was completely wrong,  the whole order was wrong  actually and the taste of the food was mediocre at best, that was the first and last time for me and my family. And when I tried calling no one answered the phone, it was already late and I was upset, we basically ate fries for dinner . if I could rate it a Zero I really would. But I'll just do one better and not give them my money at all.
